author: rbb
msg: Some more cleanup.  Stop trying to compile signals.

author: rbb
msg: I am removing signal'ing logic from APR.  Apache doesn't need the features
it is providing.  It is a really dumbed down version of signal'ing,
because it had to be portable.  Maybe in the future, we will try to
get signal'ing working across platform again.

author: rbb
msg: Cleanup the ZZZ comments.  Basically these used to mark places where APR
is needed.  It is much easier to do this conversion by hand than by
searching for old comments, so they are going away now.

author: rbb
msg: Moving Unix socket IOL's to use APR.  Also fixed a small bug in ap_recv.
We should NEVER return a status of APR_EAGAIN and say -1 bytes read.  This

author: rbb
msg: This is a needed addition to "putting" files into APR on Unix.
